message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The procedure that involves the removal of a portion of a breast is called a lumpectomy. Vasectomy is a male sterilization procedure, mastectomy is the complete removal of a breast, and laminectomy is a surgical procedure for decompressing the spinal cord.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Among the options, only lumpectomy involves the removal of a portion of a breast. Vasectomy involves sterilization of the male reproductive system. Mastectomy involves the complete removal of the breast. Laminectomy is a surgical procedure that involves removing a portion of the vertebral bone.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient's concern about breast cancer removal indicates that the correct answer is Lumpectomy, which involves the removal of a portion of the breast tissue. Mastectomy involves the removal of the entire breast. Vasectomy is a surgical procedure for male sterilization, and Laminectomy is a surgical procedure to remove a portion of the vertebral bone called the lamina.

Mastectomy involves the removal of the entire breast. Laminectomy involves the removal of a portion of the vertebral arch.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The choice of surgical approach for breast cancer is dependent on different factors, but the surgical procedure that involves the removal of a portion of a breast is a lumpectomy. Vasectomy is a procedure for male sterilization, mastectomy involves removal of the entire breast, and laminectomy is a surgical procedure to remove bony structures of the vertebrae in the spine.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Among the options, only lumpectomy involves the removal of a portion of a breast to remove the cancerous tissue, while preserving as much of the healthy breast tissue as possible. Vasectomy is a surgical procedure for male sterilization, mastectomy involves the removal of the entire breast, and laminectomy is a surgical procedure to remove a portion of the vertebral bone called the lamina.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Among the options, only lumpectomy involves the removal of a portion of a breast. Vasectomy is a contraceptive procedure that involves cutting or blocking the vas deferens. Mastectomy involves the removal of the entire breast. Laminectomy is a surgical procedure to relieve pressure on the spinal cord or nerves.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient’s concern is about the surgical approach to remove her breast cancer. Among the options, only lumpectomy involves the removal of a portion of a breast. Vasectomy involves male sterilization, mastectomy involves the complete removal of the breast tissue, and laminectomy involves decompression of the spinal cord.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The question is asking for the surgical approach that involves the removal of a portion of the breast. Among the options, only lumpectomy fits the description. Vasectomy is a procedure for male sterilization. Mastectomy is the removal of the entire breast. Laminectomy is the removal of the bony arches of one or more vertebrae.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Lumpectomy involves the removal of the cancerous tissue along with a margin of surrounding healthy tissue, while preserving the rest of the breast. Mastectomy involves the complete removal of the breast, and is not the preferred approach for early-stage breast cancer such as in this patient's case. Vasectomy is a procedure for male sterilization, and laminectomy is a surgical procedure for the removal of the lamina (bony arch) of a vertebra.
